newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes up at year-high against US dollar.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes up at year-high against US dollar.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed up at a year-high of 8.3043 against the U.S. dollar on Tuesday from Monday's 8.3048 in dull trading on the Shanghai-based interbank foreign exchange market.
Dealers said the yuan hit a year-high for the second day in a row on strong pro-yuan sentiment sparked by China's growing foreign trade surplus announced last weekend.
The yuan opened up at 8.3047, hitting an intra-day low of 8.3048, and consolidated around 8.3045 for most of the session, hitting a high of 8.3040.

Trading was dull, with most done at about 8.3045, traders said. "If the yuan stands firm above 8.3050 in the short term, it will test the next key resistance level of 8.3000 before the end of the year," a trader said.
"But the dull trading limited the yuan's rise and forced it to move in a narrow range today," said a second trader.
Dealers expect the yuan to rise slightly on Wednesday.
The yuan closed down after rising for several days at 7.5391 from 7.5030 against 100 Japanese yen. It closed unchanged at 1.0732 against the Hong Kong dollar.
